resources.description: Google have created courses to help developers that are learning how to code. They are free!

resources.name: Gravit Designer
resources.description: A cross-platform design tool for the 21st century.

resources.name: CODE.org
resources.description: CODE focuses on bringing access to computer science to everyone. Learn free today!

resources.name: Scratch
resources.description: Scratch helps newcomers learn how to code in a creative way.

resources.name: Bento
resources.description: Learn to code the way professional programmers do! - Note: You need Google+ or Facebook to sign up

resources.name: Codecademy
resources.description: Codecademy teaches you HTML/CSS, Java, jQuery, JavaScript, Ruby, Python and even APIs!

resources.name: Khan Academy
resources.description: While being able to learn mathematics too, Khan Academy can also teach you Computer programming!

resources.name: eDX
resources.description: eDX offers free online courses from the world's best universities. There are some official Microsoft courses you could try out. These are timed courses or self-paced. Depending on the course-giver.

resources.name: CodeCombat
resources.description: CodeCombat helps you code by fighting monsters while teaching you about coding!

resources.name: CodePen
resources.description: CodePen is a place where you can test your code in an interactive play area.  HTML, CSS, Javascript

resources.name: Electron
resources.description: Build cross-platform desktop applications wih JavaScript, HTML & CSS.

resources.name: TechTerms
resources.description: TechTerms is a dictionary for geeks, nerds & programmers!

resources.name: StackBlitz

resources.name: Atom
resources.description: A hackable text editor for the 21st Century
